data.title: Fixed Tiberian Sun units walking over icy water

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
First steps towards https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8918. This sets the initial state correctly. Also adds a `/debugice` chat command.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/13035996/1177fda8-d35c-11e5-9673-936d0f1bb2bc.png)

data.title: Do not render trails under fog by default.
data.body:
Exposed a boolean for rendering a `SpriteEffect` under fog. Exposed a setting in `LeavesTrails` for this boolean. Sandworm trails in D2k remains visible under fog thanks to this.

There's a usecase of `SpriteEffect` in `SpawnActorPower` as well, but I'll assume there that the spawned actor will reveal the fog for the animation if intended to be seen.

data.title: Added the regrow-able LAT ice sets to the map editor
data.body: Looks like they have been forgotten. Small step towards https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8918.

data.title: Added kerning support to SpriteFont.DrawText

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5017. Depends on #10666.

data.title: Added the Tiberian Sun beacon
data.body: While cleaning up the existing `PlaceBeacon` I noticed that it is over-engineered for the artwork used in RA2/TS so I created a new simplified trait.

data.title: Individual factory queues + multiple available buildlimited units = bypassing buildlimit exploit
data.body:
Have two or more available buildlimited units in the same factory queue.
Have more factories than this buildlimit.
Queue at least two of these units on all factories in approx the same time in the same order.
Wait.
The second unit will bypass the buildlimit.

When the last instance to reach the buildlimit of the first unit finishes, all factories which were still training it will switch to this second unit along with the factory which kicked it out and start producing it in the same frame, leading so that all factories will kick out the second unit in the same frame, rendering the buildlimit check bypassable.

Solution A would be to track the queued units for buildlimit check, solution B would be to add a delay of some frames to interrupted production to prevent such from happening.

data.title: Added the medic heal cursor
data.body: including a small tidy up.

data.title: Change grid color for the map editor.
data.body: IMO the red grid is a bit straining for the eyes. It should be darker, e.g. dark red or black.

data.title: Add bigger terrain tiles to the map editor.
data.body: Easy way to help map makers work much faster. 3x3 and 5x5 tiles would be nice.

data.title: Improve Util.Shuffle
data.body: Reduce algorithmic complexity from O(n^2) to O(n).

data.title: Fixed not dropping targets that are out of range if the attacker cannot move
data.body:
From the [original PR](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9874):

> I noticed that my mammy in guard stance was trying to shoot a far away harvester while letting himself kill by infantry.
> 
> Closes #9837.
> Closes #6185.
> Closes #9849.

data.title: Fix App.configs setup
data.body: Right now only `OpenRA.Test.csproj` has a proper App.config. The other 2 are just files dropped in the main repo dir without the .sln file knowing about them.

data.title: Gave veins an orange minimap color
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10407. The original black is confusing. I chose DarkOrange3 which fits to the terrain sprites.

data.title: Add an explicit YamlException to ArmamentInfo
data.body:
Throw a more descriptive exception when the current weapon ruleset
doesn't contain an entry for the referenced weapon.

``` yaml
Armament@pew:
    Weapon: PewPew
    ...
```


data.title: [RA] Option to show/hide '% of game played' information in the replay viewer.
data.body: Like TD and D2K the U.I. shouldn't reveal how much of the game has passed. It's a spoiler for viewing other people's replays, including casts.

data.title: Added missing Requires<AircraftInfo> to FallsToEarthInfo.
data.body: I hope this fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10743, but either way the requires is necessary.

data.title: Fix max view distance check.
data.body:
A range of 51 wasn't stopped by the original statement.  It triggered an out of bounds exception from TilesByDistance a few lines later.

This is my first pull request.  Let me know if I did something wrong.

data.title: Missiles seem to ignore CruiseAltitude and MaximumLaunchAngle
data.body:
They appear to launch and stay at a slightly upwards course until close enough to target when they start to descent (assuming it's a ground target).

Best observed with a missile projectile with high range, low speed, shadow and on flat terrain.

data.title: Fix Missile projectile crashing with NRE if it has no Image
data.body: Closes #10739.

data.title: Missiles crash with NRE if projectile Image is null
data.body:
Unlike `Bullet`, `Missile` doesn't `yield break` in `IEnumerable<IRenderable> Render` when `anim = null`.
This currently makes invisible tracking projectiles (or tracking projectiles where only the trail and/or contrail is visible) impossible unless you work around it with an empty shp, so I consider this a bug or at least an unnecessary limitation.

I'll submit a fix shortly.

data.title: Two values in Range on SpreadWarhead gives Divide by Zero
data.body:
Here is an error log: http://pastebin.com/zsbhfRhf

This happened to me when I had the first two values in Ranged: on a SpreadDamage warhead as the same value, like:

Range: 256, 256

It should give some meaningful error instead of "Attempted to divide by zero."

data.title: Add switch to sequences for first facing = south
data.body:
Unit art in C&C/Dune games always uses north/up facing as first facing.

However, there are games like MechCommander where the first facing in sprites is south/down, so they currently require some annoying work-arounds (using either `Frames:` or `Combine:` to re-order the frames).

It would be easier to have a simple boolean switch to handle this in a way that doesn't require manually ordering (which is both time-consuming and makes the sequence yamls larger).
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30797381-add-switch-to-sequences-for-first-facing-south?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Holding down backspace should repeatedly delete text
data.body:
#9791 introduced the problem where you have to press backspace for each letter you want to removed in text fields. See the PR for details. This issue is as a reminder so people don't forget to revert it and make a better fix for #9737
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30789021-holding-down-backspace-should-repeatedly-delete-text?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix the misleading wording of the confirm dialogs
data.body: Noticeable when leaving the map editor. Previously it asked you "Exit and lose all unsaved changes" and gave you `[Cancel]` and `[Abort]` which might be confusing (which one is the correct button?).

data.title: Support power timers should not reset on capture
data.body:
How it works right now:
1. Capture someone's missile silo
2. Evidence the nuke timer reset

How It should be:
1. Capture someone's missile silo
2. Evidence that the nuke timer is transferred to you, so you can continue building it

The same should apply to Chronosphere, GPS and Iron Curtain (and also Parabombs? Spy plane?).

Thoughts?
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30758864-support-power-timers-should-not-reset-on-capture?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Create singletons for AttackOrFleeFuzzy rulesets
data.body:
This avoids the cost of recreating the engines and rules for every AI and AI squad.

For a 200% speed replay with a 4 AI FFA on Tournament Island, RA, this saves 1.55% in total CPU used.
